title: Which president got the lowest SAT scores? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Hmm, this is relatively difficult to answer since the SAT has only been instituted during this 1900’s so that would make it difficult to compare SAT scores. Not to mention not many president’s have disclosed their scores either. However, I will answer your question subjectively based on the intelligence of past and present president’s. First on my list is probably John Quincy Adams. He was an exceptionally smart guy who went to Harvard Law school and achieved diplomatic success. Rumor has it that his IQ score was around 180 and that’s comparable to some geniuses. Second on my list is Thomas Jefferson. He was an inventor, multilingual, and a president of the United States. If that doesn’t impress you, then I don’t know what will. Third is James Madison. I’m quite frankly most impressed with his work as a political author for the federalist papers. Rumor also has it that he has an IQ of 155 which is exceptionally smart. As for the Presidents who I think would score the lowest on the SATs I would probably say Donald Trump. Say what you want about him, I just think he’s an idiot. His professors at Columbia said he was the laziest kid in the class. And for crying out loud, if you don’t believe climate change is real, I don’t know what to tell you. Two other presidents who id think wouldn’t do well on the SATs is probably Andrew Jackson and Ulysses S. Grant. My reasoning for Andrew Jackson is that he grew up on a rural farm and had no formal education. He was simply a war hero populist president who broke the standards of what a president should be. As for Ulysses S. Grant, yes he was a war hero, but that doesn’t equate to being smart. His whole presidency was plagued by corruption. His military successes were luck driven unlike his counterpart Robert E. Lee who was a genuine military genius. Again, these are my subjective rankings. I think in general, all president’s leading up to Andrew Jackson were all very smart individuals who would have no problem acing the SATs.

When Reagan and George H.W. Bush were applying to universities, there wasn’t a need for the SAT. So the only Presidents for whom an SAT test would have been a thing were Clinton, George W. Bush, Obama, and Trump, which is a fairly small pool. Further complicating an answer is that nobody releases SAT scores. Heck, I would doubt that my wife even knows my SAT scores, and we’ve been married for a while now. So with those limiting factors understood, we can take guesses: Clinton went to Georgetown in the 1960’s so must have done alright. He later won a Rhodes scholarship and went to Oxford to study PPE, so he was no dummy.George W. Bush went to Philips Academy in Massachusetts for high school, and from there to Yale. Again, he must have done alright to get into Yale.Obama went on full scholarship to Occidental College and then transferred to Columbia as a junior. Again, he was clearly no idiot.Trump went the New York Military Academy, a private boarding school, and then to Fordham in 1964. Fordham is not a bad school, but it is not as good as the other schools listed. He then transferred to Penn, which is not trivial, and clearly shows some ability. However, in 2015, Trump’s then lawyer, Michael Cohen, threatened both Fordham and the New York Military Academy with legal action if they released Trump’s academic records. He has also threatened legal action if anyone releases his SAT scores.[1]Given that, the most likely guess, and it is a guess, is that it is Trump. Footnotes[1] Michael Cohen Says Trump Told Him to Threaten Schools Not to Release Grades
